alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:11PM CDT until June 02 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: .A line of thunderstorms moving east through the area will produce localized very heavy rain and minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, in northwest Texas, Floyd, Hale, Hockley, Lamb and Lubbock. In the Panhandle of Texas, Briscoe and Swisher. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Plainview, Tulia, Abernathy, Hale Center, Silverton, Shallowater, Idalou, Lockney, Petersburg, Anton, Kress, Cotton Center, Vigo Park, Aiken, Claytonville, Halfway, Mackenzie Reservoir, Spade and Lubbock International Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
